summary: Diff implements a minimal backend health query and a frontend banner-based reachability check, plus several frontend runtime hardening changes (scroll-to-section try/catch, defensive rendering, mailto form). However, the diff summary does not show any concrete changes addressing the stated deployment failure root cause, nor any audit/fix of missing static assets beyond referencing specific /assets/generated paths.

missing_requirements.requirement: Identify and fix the root cause of the deployment failure so the project can build and deploy successfully end-to-end (frontend bundling + Motoko compilation; deploy succeeds; no new build-time warnings).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff summary shows UI/runtime adjustments and a new health-check method, but does not include any build/deploy pipeline, configuration, dependency, or import/path fixes that would clearly resolve an end-to-end deployment failure. Without evidence of changes to build tooling/config or the failing area, this requirement is not demonstrably implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Audit and fix broken/missing static assets (especially under /assets/generated) so images load without 404s after deployment; ensure hero/background and logo assets load in light/dark; keep assets served from frontend public pathing.
missing_requirements.reason: Multiple components reference specific generated asset paths, but the diff summary does not show any added/updated asset files under a public assets directory, nor any changes that ensure those referenced files exist. Therefore the asset audit/fix is not evidenced as completed.

hallucinated_features.description: Broad visual/theme redesign (e.g., “government-grade design tokens”, OKLCH palette, reduced radius) beyond what is required for build/deploy stabilization and smoke-test fixes.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly lists as a non-goal to redesign the site or change marketing copy except where strictly necessary to fix broken UI behavior/errors. The diff summary indicates substantial theme work in global styles and Tailwind configuration, which is not requested by REQ-19..22.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (mentions changes to frontend/src/index.css and frontend/tailwind.config.js)

hallucinated_features.description: Additional SEO/Open Graph/Twitter metadata changes in the HTML entry point.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-19..22 (which focus on build/deploy, runtime smoke test, backend health surface, and static asset fixes).

hallucinated_features.description: Footer additions such as “Caffeine.ai attribution with UTM tracking” and “valid external social links”.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-19..22; also risks violating the non-goal of changing marketing/copy except to fix broken behavior.
